body_html: @drpngx Thanks, I think @ebrevdo 's concern was that the proposed sampled_sparse_softmax_loss was the only place where the special case logic for getting true indices was used. I have now removed that special case logic from _compute_sampled_logits and added the specific use case directly to sampled_sparse_softmax_loss.
body_text: @drpngx Thanks, I think @ebrevdo 's concern was that the proposed sampled_sparse_softmax_loss was the only place where the special case logic for getting true indices was used. I have now removed that special case logic from _compute_sampled_logits and added the specific use case directly to sampled_sparse_softmax_loss.
body: @drpngx Thanks, I think @ebrevdo 's concern was that the proposed `sampled_sparse_softmax_loss` was the only place where the special case logic for getting true indices was used. I have now removed that special case logic from `_compute_sampled_logits` and added the specific use case directly to `sampled_sparse_softmax_loss`.
